topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551f1bf26368725ef8770000#post_551f1bf26368725ef8770000
[bq="EHAN"]My computer told me that the cooling system isn't working right

Am I gonna die[/bq]
Replace the coolant; use a aircan to clean out dust and you should be fine.

Side note: for the love of god don't push too hard when putting the cpu fan back on!  That's the number one mistake people make is that they think they have to ram it in there with enough force to bash a door open and as a result break it.  When you put a cpu fan gently do it; imagine it's like a eggshell you have to gently apply the fan onto it then put the latches back on and have them firm.

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551f1d6a6368721f21d50200#post_551f1d6a6368721f21d50200
[bq="EHAN"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551f1c5563687247cc7e0800#post_551f1c5563687247cc7e0800
I'm not sure if it was a result of me kinda blocking the vent earlier either, the computer stopped being hot once I pulled it away

I'm sure that's bad for the computer but it's seen better days anyways[/bq]
In that case take a aircan, take off the cover for your tower and then just spray around in it to clear dust out.

Don't use a aerosal can or air fresheners though; computer stores often sell aircans to clean out and they're only like $3.
